subject: Politics
title: Rare Earth Minerals
description: A fast breakdown of Rare Earth Minerals for builders.

hook.text: Your phone needs 30 rare minerals. China processes 60% of them. That makes Beijing a tech gatekeeper.

buildup.text: Rare earth minerals are essential for electronics, weapons, and green energy. They're not rare â€” just hard to process.

discovery.text: China dominates processing because it accepted the pollution others wouldn't. Now it controls a strategic chokepoint.

twist.text: The US and EU are scrambling to build alternative supply chains. But catching up takes a decade or more.

climax.text: The green energy transition needs massive rare earth supplies. Climate goals depend on mining politics.

punchline.text: Green energy needs dirty mining. The politics of minerals shape the future.

quiz.question: Why does China dominate rare earth mineral processing?
options: It accepted the environmental costs others wouldn't, building processing dominance
It has all the world's rare earth deposits
International law gives China exclusive processing rights
